caption:
REPOST 🔁 @morgansandiego 💜

Should you work as a 1099 or W2 employee?
 
Nurses, SAVE this post if you’re considering your options.

And make sure you know the benefits of W2 and the risks of 1099 contracting!
 
Benefits of W2 employment:
 
1️⃣. Benefits (if you elect to have them and meet hourly requirements)
2️⃣. Workers comp (if you get hurt on the job)
3️⃣. Unemployment insurance
4️⃣. Overtime (1099 contractors are straight pay, no matter how many hours they work)
5️⃣. No required quarterly tax payments (pay at the end of the year)
 
Additional benefits of being a W2 employee with @connectRNapp:

1️⃣. Choose when and where you want to work
2️⃣. Get paid FAST, within a day of your shift
3️⃣. Access to a 24-7 exclusive community forum of other healthcare professionals
 
Sign up with @connectRNapp to get these exclusive benefits!
 
Note: This is not tax or accounting advice. Please consult your tax professional about tax designations appropriate for your situation.
